page.title: 11NTS COUNTRYSIDE CENTRE
page.content: The present building was opened in 1972,before that there was a small hut.This building, is a chalet style wooden one with a veranda.There are maps, pictures, charts and specimens of local shells& rocks,lists of birds commonly, and less commonly found in the area.For sale are maps and books. There is an{audio visual}room with an informative and interesting commentary on the slides of local views,wild life and plants.On the walls are pictures comparing and contrasting the red deer and roe deer; also samples of skins of otter,pine martin,fox and wild cat and pictures of eagles and other birds of prey.A sand tray for making prints of deer,goats & sheep hoofs is popular with the children.The Centre,providing all local information on walks,geology B&B etc,and{Ranger guided walks}opens 10am to 6 pm from June to end of Sept.
